global:
Usage: playwright-cli <command> [options]
Commands:
  click <ref>                             perform click on a web page
  close                                   close the page
  dblclick <ref>                          perform double click on a web page
  console <level>                         returns all console messages
  drag <startRef> <endRef>                perform drag and drop between two elements
  evaluate <function> <ref>               evaluate javascript expression on page or element
  upload-file                             upload one or multiple files
  handle-dialog <accept> <promptText>     handle a dialog
  hover <ref>                             hover over element on page
  open <url>                              open url
  go-back                                 go back to the previous page
  network-requests                        returns all network requests since loading the page
  press <key>                             press a key on the keyboard
  resize <width> <height>                 resize the browser window
  run-code <code>                         run playwright code snippet
  select-option <ref> <values>            select an option in a dropdown
  snapshot                                capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot
  screenshot <ref>                        take a screenshot of the current page. you can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.
  type <text>                             type text into editable element
  wait-for                                wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass
  tab <action> <index>                    close a browser tab
  mouse-click-xy <x> <y>                  click left mouse button at a given position
  mouse-drag-xy <startX> <startY> <endX> <endY> drag left mouse button to a given position
  mouse-move-xy <x> <y>                   move mouse to a given position
  pdf-save                                save page as pdf
  start-tracing                           start trace recording
  stop-tracing                            stop trace recording

commands.click:
playwright-cli click <ref>

Perform click on a web page

Arguments:
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
Options:
  --button	button to click, defaults to left
  --modifiers	modifier keys to press
commands.dblclick:
playwright-cli dblclick <ref>

Perform double click on a web page

Arguments:
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
Options:
  --button	button to click, defaults to left
  --modifiers	modifier keys to press
commands.console:
playwright-cli console <level>

Returns all console messages

Arguments:
  <level>	Level of the console messages to return. Each level includes the messages of more severe levels. Defaults to "info".
commands.drag:
playwright-cli drag <startRef> <endRef>

Perform drag and drop between two elements

Arguments:
  <startRef>	Exact source element reference from the page snapshot
  <endRef>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
Options:
  --headed	run browser in headed mode
commands.evaluate:
playwright-cli evaluate <function> <ref>

Evaluate JavaScript expression on page or element

Arguments:
  <function>	() => { /* code */ } or (element) => { /* code */ } when element is provided
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.upload-file:
playwright-cli upload-file 

Upload one or multiple files

Options:
  --paths	the absolute paths to the files to upload. can be single file or multiple files. if omitted, file chooser is cancelled.
commands.handle-dialog:
playwright-cli handle-dialog <accept> <promptText>

Handle a dialog

Arguments:
  <accept>	Whether to accept the dialog.
  <promptText>	The text of the prompt in case of a prompt dialog.
commands.hover:
playwright-cli hover <ref>

Hover over element on page

Arguments:
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.open:
playwright-cli open <url>

Open URL

Arguments:
  <url>	The URL to navigate to
Options:
  --headed	run browser in headed mode
commands.go-back:
playwright-cli go-back 

Go back to the previous page
commands.network-requests:
playwright-cli network-requests 

Returns all network requests since loading the page

Options:
  --includeStatic	whether to include successful static resources like images, fonts, scripts, etc. defaults to false.
commands.press:
playwright-cli press <key>

Press a key on the keyboard

Arguments:
  <key>	Name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `ArrowLeft` or `a`
commands.resize:
playwright-cli resize <width> <height>

Resize the browser window

Arguments:
  <width>	Width of the browser window
  <height>	Height of the browser window
commands.run-code:
playwright-cli run-code <code>

Run Playwright code snippet

Arguments:
  <code>	A JavaScript function containing Playwright code to execute. It will be invoked with a single argument, page, which you can use for any page interaction.
commands.select-option:
playwright-cli select-option <ref> <values>

Select an option in a dropdown

Arguments:
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot
  <values>	Array of values to select in the dropdown. This can be a single value or multiple values.
commands.snapshot:
playwright-cli snapshot 

Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot

Options:
  --filename	save snapshot to markdown file instead of returning it in the response.
commands.screenshot:
playwright-cli screenshot <ref>

Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

Arguments:
  <ref>	Exact target element reference from the page snapshot.
Options:
  --filename	file name to save the screenshot to. defaults to `page-{timestamp}.{png|jpeg}` if not specified.
  --fullPage	when true, takes a screenshot of the full scrollable page, instead of the currently visible viewport.
commands.type:
playwright-cli type <text>

Type text into editable element

Arguments:
  <text>	Text to type into the element
Options:
  --submit	whether to submit entered text (press enter after)
commands.wait-for:
playwright-cli wait-for 

Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

Options:
  --time	the time to wait in seconds
  --text	the text to wait for
  --textGone	the text to wait for to disappear
commands.tab:
playwright-cli tab <action> <index>

Close a browser tab

Arguments:
  <action>	Action to perform on tabs, 'list' | 'new' | 'close' | 'select'
  <index>	Tab index. If omitted, current tab is closed.
commands.mouse-click-xy:
playwright-cli mouse-click-xy <x> <y>

Click left mouse button at a given position

Arguments:
  <x>	X coordinate
  <y>	Y coordinate
commands.mouse-drag-xy:
playwright-cli mouse-drag-xy <startX> <startY> <endX> <endY>

Drag left mouse button to a given position

Arguments:
  <startX>	Start X coordinate
  <startY>	Start Y coordinate
  <endX>	End X coordinate
  <endY>	End Y coordinate
commands.mouse-move-xy:
playwright-cli mouse-move-xy <x> <y>

Move mouse to a given position

Arguments:
  <x>	X coordinate
  <y>	Y coordinate
commands.pdf-save:
playwright-cli pdf-save 

Save page as PDF

Options:
  --filename	file name to save the pdf to. defaults to `page-{timestamp}.pdf` if not specified.
